body.body: Put 100 μL of 1% \(w/v) KOH into the wells of 96-well MTP followed by incubation for 5 min at 37°C and subsequent washing with 300 μL of UPW five times. Washing can also be performed with an automatic plate washer.

title: **CRITICAL STEP**
body: KOH treatment is optimal at 5 min but it should not be longer than 10 min, which can cause surface aberrations that impact the bioanalytical performance of developed immunoassay.

body.body: Incubate the KOH-treated MTP with 100 μL of GNPs \(1 mg mL<sup>-1</sup>) in 0.25% \(v/v) APTES for 1 h at RT inside the fume cabinet. Wash the GNPs-functionalized wells extensively with UPW \(as described in step 1).

title: **CRITICAL STEP**
body: One mg of GNPs should be mixed with 1 mL of 0.25% APTES and dispersed by keeping in an ultrasonic bath for 1 h before use.

title: **Antibody immobilization and BSA blocking   \(TIMING 1 h 30 min)**

body.body: Incubate 990 μL of anti-LCN2 capture antibody \(2 µg mL<sup>-1</sup>) with 10 μL of EDC \(4 mg mL<sup>-1</sup>) for 15 min at 37°C.

title: **CRITICAL STEP**
body: The optimized concentration of EDC is critical for the crosslinking of antibodies.

body.body: Put 100 µL of EDC-activated anti-LCN2 antibody to the GNPs-functionalized wells followed by incubation for 1 h at 37°C and subsequent washing with 400 µL of PBST five times.
Block the antibody-bound wells with 400 µL of 1% \(w/v) BSA for 30 min at 37°C followed by extensive PBST washing \(as mentioned in step 4).

title: **CRITICAL STEP**
body: Use diagnostic grade BSA that does not interfere with the immunoassay components. Also filter the prepared BSA in order to remove any contaminanting substances.

body.body: Add 100 µL of varying LCN2 concentrations \(0.6-5120 pg mL<sup>-1</sup>) to different BSA-blocked wells. Incubate for 1 h at 37°C and wash extensively with PBST \(as stated in step 4).
Add 100 µL of biotinylated anti-LCN2 antibody in each of the LCN2-captured wells. Incubate for 1 h at 37°C and wash extensively with PBS \(as mentioned in step 4).
Add 100 µL of SA-HRP conjugate to the biotinylated anti-LCN2 antibody treated wells. Incubate for 20 min at 37°C and wash extensively with PBST \(as mentioned in step 4).
Add 100 µL of TMB-H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> mixture to the wells of MTP and incubate at RT for 20 min to develop color.
Stop the enzyme-substrate reaction by adding 50 µL of 2 N H<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> to each well.
Measure the absorbance at a primary wavelength of 450 nm and secondary wavelength of 540 nm in the Tecan MTP reader.

title: **CRITICAL STEP**
body: Determine the absorbance after 5 min of stopping the enzyme substrate reaction so that the reaction is effectively stopped. But the reading should be taken before 10 min.
